intro: Mesosphaerum obtectum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has succulent leaves that help it conserve water, making it well adapted to harsh, dry environments. It produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Mesosphaerum obtectum is often found in sandy soils and is considered a valuable plant for stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion.
